Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CRAMP-2 (mouse cathelin-related antimicrobial peptide 2; predicted AMPs; UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (86.84%) toCRAMP-1K: 21%; L=G: 13%. GRAVY: -0.58; M. Wt.: 4291.174; Mol Formula: C197H339N55O50; Mol Ex Coeff: 0.Activity: Active against E. coli ATCC 25922 or ML35 or D21 (MIC 0.5-2 uM), S. typhimurium ATCC 14028 (MIC 8 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 4 uM), S. marcescens ATCC 8100 (MIC 4 uM), P-vulgaris ATCC 13315 (MIC>64 uM), S. aureus ATCC 25923 or Cowan I or MRSA (MIC 32-64 or greater), S. epidermidis ATCC 12228 (MIC 16 uM), S. faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC 16 uM), B. megaterium Bm11 (MIC 4 uM), fumgi C-albicans (MIC > 64 uM), C. neoformans (MIC 16 uM). The activity spectrum is essentially the same as a hypothetically alternatively cleaved form called CARMP-1 (see AP00281).
Literature Information.Author: Gallo RL, Kim KJ, Bernfield M, Kozak CA, Zanetti M, Merluzzi L, Gennaro R.1997
Literature Information.Title: Identification of CRAMP, a cathelin-related antimicrobial peptide expressed in the embryonic and adult mouse.
